definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: The downgrade clock began to tick.
sentences.chinese: 美國信用降級的時鐘開始發出滴答聲。

sentences.english: Instead, it was the number of de-escalating gestures that grew.
sentences.chinese: 相反卻是降級姿態在增多。

sentences.english: Would it be seen as a demotion?
sentences.chinese: 這是否會是被視爲一個降級？

sentences.english: The goal of navigating conflict is to de-escalate.
sentences.chinese: 引導衝突的目標是要降級。

sentences.english: He was degraded for being drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他因酗酒而受到降級處分。

sentences.english: I think Birmingham City are prime candidates for relegation next season.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲下個賽季伯明翰城隊最有可能降級。

sentences.english: Other times, the epigenome demotes a gene.
sentences.chinese: 有時候表觀基因會把基因降級。

sentences.english: He was degraded from office for his dereliction of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他因瀆職而受到降級處分。

sentences.english: It will take something very special to avoid relegation.
sentences.chinese: 由此可見，要想避免降級，萊切得好好費些思量。

sentences.english: There are several reasons for that – it’s a puzzle with many pieces.
sentences.chinese: 降級有好幾個原因，就像拼圖有好多拼板那樣。

sentences.english: The sergeant was degraded to private for the reason of disobeying order.
sentences.chinese: 這個軍官因爲違抗命令被祕密降級了。

sentences.english: He's coming from two relegations and has a lot of ill to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他經歷過兩支球隊的降級，有很強的慾望學東西。

sentences.english: Watford is bottom of the table and facing the drop into the Championship.
sentences.chinese: 沃特福德現時敬陪末席，並面對降級到英冠的危機。

sentences.english: Ireland's debt was downgraded for a second time on June 8th.
sentences.chinese: 6月8日，愛爾蘭政府的債券被第二次降級。

sentences.english: But what caused this downgrade of Civic’s brand?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼原因致使思域品牌遭遇這種降級呢？

sentences.english: In this paper, the falling order method of computation is suggested for the determination of positions of complex planar linkages.
sentences.chinese: 提出了降級算法，用以確定複雜平面連桿機構的位置。

definition: hook (on which to hang sth)/to couple/to link together/to establish contact with/hook/coupling links (e.g. between two railway coaches)
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to owe a debt/the sum owed
